description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国在朝鲜战争中参战的中国人民解放军外派部队的总称。名义上是志愿，实际上是以解放军完整建制参加战斗。
description.en: The common name for the armed forces deployed by the People's Republic of China to fight in the Korean War. Nominally a volunteer army, it was in fact a fully-fledged military force of the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家、军事家，中华人民共和国元帅。曾任中国人民志愿军司令员兼政治委员。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader, Marshal of the People's Republic of China. He served as the Commander and Political Commissar of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、理论家，中华人民共和国的主要缔造者。时任中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会主席，签署了组成中国人民志愿军的命令。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, politician, and theorist, the main founder of the People's Republic of China. As Chairman of the Central People's Government People's Revolutionary Military Commission, he signed the order to form the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

nodes.id: 中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会

zh-cn: 中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会
en: Central People's Government People's Revolutionary Military Commission

description.zh-cn: 1949年至1954年间中华人民共和国最高的国家军事领导机关，负责领导全国武装力量。
description.en: The highest state military leading body of the People's Republic of China from 1949 to 1954, responsible for leading the nation's armed forces.

description.zh-cn: 一场始于1950年6月25日的朝鲜半岛军事冲突，一方是朝鲜民主主义人民共和国和中国人民志愿军，另一方是大韩民国和联合国军。
description.en: A military conflict on the Korean Peninsula that began on June 25, 1950, between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (supported by the Chinese People's Volunteer Army) and the Republic of Korea (supported by the United Nations Command).

description.zh-cn: 根据联合国安理会决议成立，由多个国家组成的军队，在朝鲜战争中支持大韩民国。
description.en: A multi-national military force established under a United Nations Security Council resolution to support the Republic of Korea during the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 为保卫中国东北边境安全而组建的中国人民解放军部队，后改编为中国人民志愿军。
description.en: A People's Liberation Army force formed to defend China's northeastern border, later reorganized into the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家、政治家，时任政务院副总理。据称他建议将入朝部队命名为“志愿军”而非“支援军”。
description.en: A Chinese educator and politician who was the Vice Premier of the Government Administration Council at the time. It is said that he suggested naming the troops entering Korea as 'Volunteer Army' instead of 'Support Army'.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第一任国务院总理，时任中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会副主席，主持了组建东北边防军的会议。
description.en: The first Premier of the People's Republic of China, then serving as Vice Chairman of the Central People's Government People's Revolutionary Military Commission, he presided over the meeting to form the Northeast Border Defense Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军上将，曾任中国人民志愿军副司令员、代司令员、司令员。
description.en: A general of the People's Liberation Army, he served as Deputy Commander, Acting Commander, and Commander of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军上将，曾任中国人民志愿军副司令员、司令员。
description.en: A general of the People's Liberation Army, he served as Deputy Commander and Commander of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军上将，曾任中国人民志愿军第三副司令员、参谋长及最后一任司令员。
description.en: A general of the People's Liberation Army, he served as the Third Deputy Commander, Chief of Staff, and the last Commander of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

description.zh-cn: 大韩民国第一任总统，在朝鲜战争停战谈判达成协议后，拒绝承认并试图破坏协议。
description.en: The first President of South Korea who, after an armistice agreement was reached in the Korean War, refused to recognize it and attempted to sabotage the deal.

zh-cn: 关于朝鲜军事停战的协定

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜人民军、中国人民志愿军与联合国军签署的旨在停止朝鲜战争中一切军事行动的协定。
description.en: The armistice agreement signed by the Korean People's Army, the Chinese People's Volunteer Army, and the United Nations Command to cease all military actions in the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜战争最后一次大规模战役，由中国人民志愿军主要针对韩国军队发动。
description.en: The last large-scale battle of the Korean War, launched by the Chinese People's Volunteer Army primarily against the South Korean army.

description.zh-cn: 大韩民国的武装力量。
description.en: The armed forces of the Republic of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的长子，在中国人民志愿军司令部担任翻译和秘书，在朝鲜战争中牺牲。
description.en: Mao Zedong's eldest son, who served as a translator and secretary at the headquarters of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army and was killed in the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国，在朝鲜战争中是联合国军的主要组成部分。
description.en: The United States of America, the main component of the United Nations Command during the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军大将，曾被任命为东北边防军司令员兼政治委员，但因病未能到任。
description.en: A general of the People's Liberation Army, he was appointed as the Commander and Political Commissar of the Northeast Border Defense Army but could not assume the post due to illness.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，曾任中共中央总书记、国家主席、中央军委主席。命令召回驻板门店的志愿军代表团。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, President of the PRC, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission. He ordered the recall of the PVA delegation from Panmunjom.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的最高军事领导机构。
description.en: The highest military leading body of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中国人民志愿军代表团

zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军代表团

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军在朝鲜军事停战委员会中的代表机构，驻扎于板门店，直至1994年撤回。
description.en: The representative body of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army in the Korean Military Armistice Commission, stationed at Panmunjom until its withdrawal in 1994.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军战斗英雄，在上甘岭战役中用身体堵住敌方机枪眼而牺牲。
description.en: A combat hero of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army, who sacrificed himself by blocking an enemy machine gun port with his body during the Battle of Triangle Hill.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜战争后期的一场著名战役，以其惨烈程度而闻名。
description.en: A famous battle in the later stages of the Korean War, known for its intensity and brutality.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军战斗英雄，在执行潜伏任务时，为不暴露目标，被联合国军燃烧弹点燃后纹丝不动，直至牺牲。
description.en: A combat hero of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army who, during an ambush mission, was set on fire by a UN Command incendiary bomb but remained motionless to avoid revealing his position, burning to death.

description.zh-cn: 以中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会主席的名义签署命令，将东北边防军改名为“中国人民志愿军”。
description.en: As Chairman of the Central People's Government People's Revolutionary Military Commission, he signed the order to rename the Northeast Border Defense Army to the 'Chinese People's Volunteer Army'.

relationships.target: 中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军由中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会领导和指挥。
description.en: The Chinese People's Volunteer Army was led and commanded by the Central People's Government People's Revolutionary Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 1950年10月19日晚，中国人民志愿军跨过鸭绿江，进入朝鲜境内参加朝鲜战争。
description.en: On the evening of October 19, 1950, the Chinese People's Volunteer Army crossed the Yalu River and entered Korea to participate in the Korean War.

position.zh-cn: 副司令员、第一副司令员、代司令员、司令员
position.en: Deputy Commander, First Deputy Commander, Acting Commander, Commander

position.zh-cn: 第三副司令员、参谋长、司令员
position.en: Third Deputy Commander, Chief of Staff, Commander

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军是由中国人民解放军东北边防军改编而成。
description.en: The Chinese People's Volunteer Army was reorganized from the Northeast Border Defense Army of the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军在朝鲜战争中与联合国军为敌对作战方。
description.en: The Chinese People's Volunteer Army and the United Nations Command were opposing combatants in the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 有说法称，时任政务院副总理的黄炎培建议将部队名称由“支援军”改为“志愿军”，以避免国际上认为中国对美国宣战。
description.en: It is said that Huang Yanpei, then Vice Premier of the Government Administration Council, suggested changing the force's name from 'Support Army' to 'Volunteer Army' to avoid the international perception that China was declaring war on the United States.

description.zh-cn: 1950年7月7日，军委副主席周恩来主持军委会议，讨论组建东北边防军。
description.en: On July 7, 1950, Vice Chairman of the Military Commission Zhou Enlai presided over a meeting to discuss the formation of the Northeast Border Defense Army.

description.zh-cn: 中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会决定粟裕为东北边防军司令员兼政治委员，但粟裕当时生病未能到任。
description.en: The Central People's Government People's Revolutionary Military Commission appointed Su Yu as Commander and Political Commissar of the Northeast Border Defense Army, but he was unable to take up the post due to illness.

description.zh-cn: 在停战协定达成后，韩国总统李承晚拒绝承认，并以“就地释放”名义将大批朝鲜人民军战俘强行编入韩军，试图破坏停战。
description.en: After the armistice agreement was reached, South Korean President Syngman Rhee refused to recognize it and attempted to sabotage the truce by forcibly incorporating a large number of Korean People's Army prisoners of war into the South Korean army under the pretext of 'on-the-spot release'.

description.zh-cn: 针对李承晚破坏停战协定的行为，中国人民志愿军发动了金城战役。
description.en: In response to Syngman Rhee's actions to sabotage the armistice agreement, the Chinese People's Volunteer Army launched the Battle of Kumsong.

description.zh-cn: 金城战役主要针对李承晚领导的韩国军队，是朝鲜战争的最后一次大规模战役。
description.en: The Battle of Kumsong primarily targeted the South Korean army led by Syngman Rhee and was the last major battle of the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸英是毛泽东的长子。
description.en: Mao Anying was Mao Zedong's eldest son.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸英在1950年11月25日的一次美军空袭中牺牲。
description.en: Mao Anying was killed in a US air raid on November 25, 1950.

relationships.target: 中国人民志愿军代表团

description.zh-cn: 时任中央军事委员会主席江泽民命令召回驻板门店军事停战委员会的中国人民志愿军代表团。
description.en: Jiang Zemin, then Chairman of the Central Military Commission, ordered the recall of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army delegation from the Military Armistice Commission in Panmunjom.

relationships.target: 中国人民志愿军代表团

description.zh-cn: 考虑到朝鲜方面的要求，中央军事委员会决定调回军停会中的中国人民志愿军代表团。
description.en: Considering the request from the North Korean side, the Central Military Commission decided to recall the Chinese People's Volunteer Army delegation from the Military Armistice Commission.

description.zh-cn: 黄继光在上甘岭战役中用身体堵住联合国军的机枪眼而阵亡。
description.en: Huang Jiguang was killed during the Battle of Triangle Hill when he used his body to block a UN machine gun emplacement.

description.zh-cn: 在执行战斗任务中，邱少云被联合国军发射的燃烧弹引燃了衣服，为保证行动不被暴露，被活活烧死。
description.en: During a combat mission, Qiu Shaoyun's clothing was ignited by an incendiary bomb fired by the UN Command. To ensure the mission was not compromised, he remained motionless and was burned to death.
